author: Gary Campla

review: We were looking for a device which would allow us to live stream content from a laptop to the television without having to plug the laptop into an hdmi port. We set this thing up and started streaming, but it was very herky jerky and hard to follow. Videos always appear more jerky than the feed. Then, although it is possible to start a video and do other things with the laptop, the interface doesn't allow you to view the video in full screen. You have to have the stream open in a google chrome window with full screen selected, and as soon as you try to alt-tab to another task the video goes out of full screen on both the laptop and the television and you have to watch a tiny window. We may try to use it when traveling so we don't have to walk over to the television every time we want to change something, but if it doesn't work better than it has, we'll stick with carrying an hdmi cable...Well, we tried taking it on a trip, and the hotel where we stay didn't allow peer to peer connections on their network. We travel with a ton of animals and really like our hotel, so going elsewhere is not an option. Since we have HDMI enabled laptops and a neotv, this thing is useless for us.

review: let me start off with the most important thing, I like my Chromecast, HOWEVER, I find myself loaded with complaints. for starters, it often crashes but Im not sure if that is the internet connection or the devices. Also I knew what i was getting in buying it, that i would be very limited on the apps that I could stream to my Chromecast, yet now that I have it, it has proven to be quite a disappointment, essentially, I what to be able to stream more apps, all of them if possible but more particularly the gallery (photos). Lastly the most disappointing thing i found was the incredible slowness and glitches with I connected my laptop to it. aside from these complaints I use it very often and I greatly appreciate the images that posted while it is idle.
